category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
God, it seems like almost no one is truly sorry for the wrong they do,
and I have so much I need to be sorry for.
I'm struggling with my temper,
and I feel ashamed and horrified by how ugly it is.
I'm determined to stop giving in to it,
and I'm coming to You for the strength to actually do that.
So many people let their anger fly and get overwhelmed by it,
making all kinds of excuses to downplay it,
like saying it just came out of nowhere,
that they didn't enjoy it,
that they feel bad about it later,
or that even good people get angry.
They try to find peace after an outburst
by just completely forgetting it happened,
or by putting a band-aid over the problem, hoping it will heal
without the real peace that comes from You.
Lord God, I know my anger flares up
whenever things don't go my way,
and it's because I'm trying to please myself, not You.
I'm realizing that in every frustrating situation, there are two things being challenged:
what I want,
and what You want.
And in every good thing, there's a part that makes me happy,
and a part that makes You happy.
My mistake is that my feelings—good or bad—
are all based on what's happening to me,
without even thinking about You.
By just letting it happen, I'm like those who were punished for not standing up to what's wrong.
Instead, I need to humbly own up to my issues
and run to You for real forgiveness and peace.
So please, give me a truly repentant heart, a real sense of humility, and a sorrow that lasts—
because I know You won't turn me away for my mistakes when I come to You like this.
